meanings.definition: The state or quality of being glaring or shining brightly.
meanings.sent1: The glarinesses of the sun hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The glarinesses of the stars lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: She shielded her eyes from the glarinesses of the flashlight.
meanings.sent4: The glarinesses of the polished mirror reflected the room's brightness.
meanings.sent5: The glarinesses of the neon sign made it impossible to miss.

meanings.definition: The act of glaring or staring intensely.
meanings.sent1: His glarinesses at the suspect made them nervous.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's glarinesses silenced the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat's glarinesses at the mouse were ineffective as it escaped.
meanings.sent4: Her glarinesses at the computer screen showed her frustration.
meanings.sent5: The glarinesses of the security guard made shoplifters think twice.

meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort or unease caused by a bright or harsh light.
meanings.sent1: The glarinesses from the headlights made driving difficult.
meanings.sent2: She squinted to avoid the glarinesses of the midday sun.
meanings.sent3: The glarinesses of the spotlight made the actor nervous.
meanings.sent4: The glarinesses of the camera flash blinded her momentarily.
meanings.sent5: He felt the glarinesses of the stage lights as he stepped on stage.
